Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: intrepid13_11
Reviews.Content: My husband, young son and I stayed at the Palazzo Odoni in November 2011. It is in a great location, a short walk from transport hubs. We were easily able to walk from the main train station on arrival and to the airport bus on leaving Venice. The host was very helpful, particularly with luggage up the stairs. The apartment was very spacious for three people, the kitchenette is small but very functional. We were able to cook for ourselves most nights. For about the same cost as an hotel, we had so much more space at the Palazzo Odoni. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Ciaccio Family”
Reviews.Author: Jamie C
Reviews.Content: I loved Michle's hopitality. The apartment was clean; the service was excellent. We loved the location, close to transportation.

Reviews.Title: “couldn't ask for more...!!!”
Reviews.Author: RAStanley
Reviews.Content: Would recommend this residence to everyone coz all of these reasons: Location wise: is very accessible (close to Piazalle Roma, St Lucia station). There are lots of good restaurant and tourist attractions that are within walking distance as well. The residence itself has a very warm and cozy feeling with a very nice courtyard. It feels like you're going to your own house in Venice.. :) Room: spacious, really clean, nice classic modern furniture with kitchenette area complete with all kitchen sets and utensils Service: really2 nice, although it would be much2 better if they have an elevator for luggage,huahauhau..but dont worry the host will help you with all the luggage afterall. You wont regret it to stay in this residence. definitely will stay here again during our next visit. ;) Cheers ;)

Reviews.Title: “Our second stay - certainly not our last!”
Reviews.Author: Elisabeth-Paula
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for water taxis, trains, buses and a big supermarket as well as many of the sights. The apartments are large and beautifully furnished, very clean and quiet. All the staff are exceptionally polite and helpful. Just the place to stay for a little longer to give one time to see lots of Venice, maybe even Padua and the Veneto as a whole! Could hardly be improved upon!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Venice”
Reviews.Author: thebrewerswife
Reviews.Content: This apartment was perfect for our family of 4. Spotless, lovely Venetian building & decor, yet modern amenities. Quiet & well equipped kitchenette, lovely hosts, good value, excellent WiFi & reasonably spacious. Delightful. We liked the location, not overly touristy & great access to P.Roma the main transport spot to get anywhere. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for late arrivals to Venice”
Reviews.Author: Wndervogel
Reviews.Content: We chose the Palazzo Odoni because we were arriving late in Venice, and wanted something easily accessible. It was perfect for that -- just a short walk from the train station and the Piazzale Roma. The room was large and clean. It's a bit of a hike from there to the main sights of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: JandM919
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Palazzo Odoni this past weekend and found the place beautiful, well-situated, excellently priced, clean, and amazingly spacious! Our apartment (named for Titian) was two floors with a very large living room with windows that opened to the canal and a great dining area. The couches in the room converted into beds for my two children, while upstairs was another bedroom and the bathroom. The included kitchen area made making snacks or little meals simple and easy, and the street that the Palazzo is located on is filled with great little restaurants, shops, and the occasional gondolier. The staff and owners of the Palazzo Odoni were very friendly and helpful as well. All in all a terrific place to stay -- we will come back again when we are in Venice. Ciao!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible experience!”
Reviews.Author: pkurtz2012
Reviews.Content: The apartments are amazing! Located in a quieter area, which was a welcome experience. You can be a tourist during the day and really relax at night. The service was great, and you get incredible value for your money. There is also a delicious and authentic Venice restaurant right next to the place - very convenient. The rooms are also very spacious and well kept. Stay here if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, comfortable and a great location”
Reviews.Author: Steve S
Reviews.Content: Lovely suite of rooms in a great neighborhood. Michele was very welcoming and accommodating. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Return to my favorite palace,Residence Palazzo Odoni”
Reviews.Author: PamellaIris
Reviews.Content: Had to return to Venice for a pleasure/business weekend, February 24th thru the 27th, and decided to, once again, stay at the Residence Palazzo Odoni. This time on my own, but not completely alone, with my adorable Chihuahua, Principessa, for company. We stayed in the Tiepolo Suite, which was easily large and comfortable enough for two to four people. So peaceful, comfortable, old world charm, new world equipped....I, appreciated the strong WiFi connection, very comfortable bed, Jacuzzi tub in the large marble bathroom and kitchen facilities. The quiet and beautiful location was easily accessible to the busy Rialto and San Marco areas by walking or taking the vaporetto or tragetto (the poor person's gondola), which crosses the canal at San Toma for less than one euro. When, sadly it was time to leave, I walked to the train station saying my farewell to my beloved Venezia. I hope to return in a few months and will definitely contact my helpful and wonderful host, Michele, to reserve again.

Reviews.Title: “Residence Palazzo Odoni”
Reviews.Author: Rod A
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for a week at the end of February, beginning of March. The Residence is very well placed for those who are self catering, with bakery, grocers etc all within a few yards. The area is very quiet, and is very handy for Piazelle Roma and vaporettos. The only problem we had was a leaky plug in the jacuzzi, which Michele rectified straight away. This was our fifth visit to Venice, and our first stay at the Residence. I can honestly recommend it. Rod Allen

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location - real find!”
Reviews.Author: BostonMA2009
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed here in late October of 2011 and we are so happy we did! The location is walking distance from the train which is super convenient. It was easy to find and very private and safe. The room we stayed in had a real regal feel to it and I have to say it had a beautiful view and was quiet at night. We both agree we WILL return here our next time in Venice. Michele was the most gracious host and very helpful. When we left we checked out and were able to leave our bags there as we walked around a bit more. I love Venice and I love Residence Palazzo Odoni. Highly recommend you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Venice with old Style”
Reviews.Author: Jonny_Doin
Reviews.Content: We stayed for the Carnevale. The room was booked with 6 months advance, and we got a very large front room, at the second floor. Very spacious, with a large vaulted bedroom, a living room, kitchen and a bathroom with a jacuzzi. The view to the canal was gorgeous. This is a *very* old construction, with a lot of stairs. Be prepared to carry your luggage yourself, over steep stairs, there is no elevators. The breakfast must be reserved in advance, and is not included in the standard room reservation. We found out that there was no breakfast for us, even if we want to pay. The whole experience was magical, and the hotel has the luxury and mystery of old Venice, especially when you get home late at night, and use the large old door keys to open the large medieval doors. It is located far from the Piazza San Marco, but the Fondamenta is quiet, and if you want to walk through the old Venice streets, it is very worth staying. We will come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great city, great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Stephenfamilyofsix
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Italy for a total of three weeks, in five hotels. Residence Palazzo Odoni was the best. The magical city of Venice as a backdrop helps. Like the most recent reviewer commented, the walk to the Hotel was a challenge, especially with four children and heavily loaded. The main bridge being the biggest hurdle to carry six 20kg plus bags and additional hand luggage. Anyway, we managed to get â€˜paidâ€™ help both there and back. The â€˜trinketâ€™ sellers on the bridge assisted with the bags and a few Euroâ€™s tip later, we were on our way. The water taxi was an option but overpriced and in the end unnecessary. More stairs to navigate once at the hotel, however Michele was there to help us with the bags. We stayed for four nights in two apartments (Tiziano and Caravaggio) on the last night Caravaggio was unavailable so we moved the kids to Canaletto. All apartments are excellent, very spacious with a kitchenette. The layout in each, quite different. Furnishings nice with modern bathrooms. We loved the area. Very quite with lots of restaurants and shops. We ate a number of the nearby restaurants and eateries. All were good with their own character. It was also nice to grab some supplies from the supermarket or food purveyors and have drinks and snacks in the room after a long day walking, experiencing Venice. We prepared breakfast in the room most mornings, however due to lack of supplies we had breakfast in the restaurant next door on one morning for 5 Euroâ€™s each â€“ very basic but fresh. I have no hesitation recommending the Apartments as a great place to stay in Venice. Whether a family or couple the residence is in a good location, very spacious, offers flexibility for meals, great service and its own special character.

Reviews.Title: “Venice a charming city with warm greetings”
Reviews.Author: sjjhope
Reviews.Content: We were met by Michel personally and he was most accommodating and helped us with our bags up all the stairs to our room. Now firstly this hotel is not on the main canal but on a smaller connecting one. If you have alot of bags you are going to feel the walk to the hotel. There is no way to avoid stairs as soon as you get off train. You need to get over main bridge across main canal ...all stairs and than you need to hop over smaller canals on the way to the hotel. A water taxi is expensive but i would've done it to avoid the complaining from my wife & kids. Anyway the hotel is charming and loved the bathroom , but make sure you pick the ones on one level not a split level...we were away from our kids and my wife was worried about the kids climbing the steep stairs at night. There is no meals here so enjoy walking around the canals and trying different food. Make sure you pay for a gondolar ride..about 100 euro for 40 mins but sure worth it when you hear about the history and see all this facinating water city has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “we loved venice!”
Reviews.Author: Rody_vE
Reviews.Content: We have had such a nice time in the city. The apartments were perfectly situated: near the city center, but far enough to stay in a quiet area and feel like you are part of the local people and not as much part of the tourist chaos. The apartments are nicely furnished in the Venice style. The only point of criticism was that the sofa beds were not very suitable for an adult. But if you bring your kids, it's fine. The owner was very helpfull and friendly. The city itself is breathtaking.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel near the cruise port and authentic Venice !”
Reviews.Author: Levo-Sa
Reviews.Content: We chose Palazzo Odoni after reading great reviews. We made abooking for a 3 person room and were surprised by Alessandro (we later learned the owner family) who personally escorted us to our 2 bedrrom apartment with a jacuzzi in the master bedroom :-) The rooms were very clean and free wi-fi in the lobby and in our room was a great surprise for our 16 year old son. We had heard about the great breakfast and it was very nice. It was a 5 minute walk to the peoplemover and straight to the cruise port. Also, the hotel is 5 minutes to the number 2 (red) line for the canal "bus" boats. A great ride through Venice and you end up right at San Marcos area. When we come back to Venice, we will stay at Palazzo Odoni since we found this part of Venice much more authentic than the San Marcos area which is much more touristy. This is definitely the place to stay. Also there is a great restaurant next to the hotel and Palazzo Odoni has agreat map of Venice with 10 suggestions of good restaurants. In summary, a great 15th century building with 10 rooms managed by a great family for 7 generations - great combination!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful apartment in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Wendy5859
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Caravaggio apartment for 5 nights in September. This was a beautiful airy apartment with a huge bedroom, lounge room and good sized bathroom in a beautiful renovated old palazzo. I had booked online with Michele some months before we arrived and everything was organised without a problem via email with our credit card details. The apartment is beautiful and gave us the opportunity to cook in a small kitchenette (quite well appointed with a good sized refrigerator) which was great after 3 weeks living in hotels and eating out. The area is very convenient to the train and bus station for arrivals and departures as well as close to the vaporetto station in Piazzale roma. There are a lot of interesting places to visit locally with wonderful restaurants and bars in Santa Margherita square about 10 mins away. There are great local bakeries and small grocery shops around including a supermarket close by in Piazzale Roma. The service from Michele and his wife Emma is great , available when needed and efficient and welcoming. The apartment overlooks a canal and at night you can watch the gondolas pass by. A wonderful experience of Venice, a beautiful city. Would love to go back and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Francine-QuÃ©bec-Canada”
Reviews.Author: Francine B
Reviews.Content: We liked very much our stay at Palazzo Odoni. The apartment was very pleasant and very clean. The owner was very nice and attentive to our needs beforee and during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and comfortable apartment. Gracious host.”
Reviews.Author: viennagrl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the Caravaggio apartment and really enjoyed it. It was clean and decorated beautifully, though simply at the same time, including interesting antiques. The bathroom was modern and convenient. We also loved the afternoon sun flooding the bedroom, just begging to open the window and take in the lovely view of the quiet canal and pretty old buildings! The palazzo itself is beautiful, especially the courtyard, which was lit with candles every evening as we returned from our adventures. The location is good, especially if your visit is not tied to St Mark's Square, which is good 20 minutes of brisk walking away. We highly recommend taking the Academia bridge route from the Palazzo to St Mark's instead of going via Rialto Bridge. It really helps avoiding hordes of tourists that flood the path between Rialto Bridge and St Mark's. One of the reasons we preferred staying in Santa Croce is because it is not as touristy and is right next to the Dorsoduro neighborhood, which is even more "off the beaten path". It was also convenient to the bus stop, so I believe we only had to take on 2 bridges going to/from the airport with our luggage. Our highest complements go to Michele. He is most gracious and accommodating host. He was always available to us. If he wasn't on the property, all we had to do is call him from our room. Two days in a row we had a hard time getting the restaurant reservations we wanted (beware: a lot of great restaurants in Venice are closed on Sundays and Mondays!) and he went out of his way to try to help us. Michele's recommended restaurant just a few steps from the Palazzo turned out to be our favorite restaurant in Venice. We also went there for breakfast every morning, which was an excellent deal though we might take more advantage of the kitchenette in the apartment next time. I hope you enjoy your stay at Residence Palazzo Odoni as much as we did!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing City!!”
Reviews.Author: robashwootton
Reviews.Content: From the moment we got of the train we loved venice, The apartment is close, but far enough away from everything, just a 15 minute walk from the train station, If you dont get lost!! we did!! directions are hard to follow anywhere and there isnt a large sign on this apartment, but thats what makes it unique, when you find it you will be good,then go out a get lost somewhere else in the city!!!! The apartment was large and clean and there are restraunts all around that have great food!!!! we really didnt spend much time in the apartment because the city is so great, so get out there and enjoy it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wow - safe, quiet, pretty”
Reviews.Author: 3redsuitcases
Reviews.Content: We are a family - Mum, Dad and 10 yr old child. Residence Palazzo Odoni was prefect for us. My child has milk allergies so the kitchenette was perfect. Basic cooking needs were supplied - olive oil, salt, pepper etc which was appreciated. The location is wonderful, not very busy, so a nice haven from a busy day. The restaurants and cafes in the area were lovely. The apartment has air condition and overall well appointed. We felt genuinely welcomed by the host and staff. Santa Croce felt a very safe and friendly area. It took us about 10-15 minutes to walk from the train station. But as all of Venice as many steps and bridges take light bags. We could happily recommend Residence Palazzo Odoni.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: PaulandJen
Reviews.Content: The staff and location made our Anniversary very special. The views, the location and the beauty of the property made our three days in Venice magical

Reviews.Title: “Great Time in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Joseph B
Reviews.Content: Michele & Emanuela together with the staff all ensured we had a great stay in Venice. From the minute we got to the apartment we were made to feel welcome. The locaion is great, it is central without being far from the bus, train stations. the whole family had a great time in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “great location, very personable”
Reviews.Author: Kris G
Reviews.Content: We loved this location- easy access from Piazza Roma with bus station, railway station, and port. The room was large- more like an apartment with a mini kitchen and dining/living area. You enter off the street into a little courtyard, and building is an old palazzo with updated plumbing. Only concern would be if you couldn't climb stairs- 48 steps up to the rooms, no elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay....”
Reviews.Author: Gouri
Reviews.Content: Palazzo Odoni is in a convinient location - not too far away from the train station & within easy walking distance from all the tourist attractions. Rooms in this 15-century building are spacious, well maintained and comfortable. Emma and Michele are gracious hosts and provided helpful tips about Venice. We had a wonderful time & we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: rainstr
Reviews.Content: Located 10 min away from the train station, just one bridge away (from the station take the bridge on the left and after that turn right, then you do not need to cross any other bridges, which is important if you have a baby carriage or a lot of luggage). Lots of small restaurants and shops nearby. And not too many people in this area of the historical city center. We had a room facing to the inner yard, but that was fine. No elevator, but the receptionist helped to carry the luggage to the second floor. Air conditioner worked fine. No mosquitoes in the room. Breakfast is good, nothing hot except for boiled eggs, but coffee is extremely good as well as the selection of yogurts with pro-biotic, natural jams without added sugar and so on - everything was of high quality. The rooms are very clean and look freshly renovated. Very quiet at night. We could safely leave our luggage in the hotel after checking out. There is a safety box in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Comfort in Venice”
Reviews.Author: DB957
Reviews.Content: Selected Residence Palazzo Odoni for a family trip to Venice. The beautifully furnished and maintained apartments perfect for our five night stay. Furniture and beds very comfortable. Well equipped kitchenette an added benefit. Breakfast is not included, but there's a very good bakery nearby or a simple buffet at a neighboring restaurant for 5 euros per person. Michele and Ema very helpful in making our arrangements and providing tips about Venice. Palazzo Odoni is in a quiet part of the city near the train station. We appreciated this after busy days in the sightseeing crowds and for ease in making a one day train trip to Padavo and Vicenza. There are some good restaurants nearby (Ribot, Ae Cravate, Bacco Felice). They're not inexpensive, but all are decently priced by Venice standards. Most of the top sights are within fifteen minutes walk from Odoni. The few that are further can be reached by taking the vaporetto (water bus) on the Grand Canal. Venice is not that large, so everything is easy to access. In summary, Palazzo Odoni offers wonderful apartments in a pleasantly quiet location with convenient access to all of Venice. We would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for families”
Reviews.Author: ahracing
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 had the chance to stay in 3 different rooms while we were staying. They were all very nice, clean and spacious. The kids loved staying in such an old building. Great location, quiet and convenient to everything. Close to the cruise port and train station. Michele was very accommodating and easy to work with.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Segundi
Reviews.Content: Palazzo Odoni is in a great locationâ€” within walking distance to restaurants and shopping. It is large enough for our family of five and nicely decorated, with large windows overlooking the canal. Our vacation was a celebration of our twenty-fifth wedding anniversary and we renewed our vows in the courtyard that was as charming as all of Venice. Ema and Michele were wonderful and very accommodating. They made our private ceremony very special, complete with candles, flowers, music and a violinist!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Experience for the entire family”
Reviews.Author: PamellaIris
Reviews.Content: Two weeks ago, I spent 4 nights at the Residence Palazzo Odoni, Venice, Italy. I was with my daughter and two grandchildren 6 and 8 years of age. We were in the Tiziano Apartment. Our stay was lovely and most elegant. The large open living room made us feel that we were royalty. The upstairs bathroom and bedroom were comfortable and attractive. We wanted to own the apartment and never leave. During the sweltering heat we were refreshed when we returned to our apartment by the comfortable air conditioning and delightfully helpful staff. It is living in an historical palace with all of the modern conveniences. My family adored the kitchen and we often planned our day over morning breakfast in our room. There is also a lovely breakfast room if you wish to be served. The location is perfect....away from the maddening crowd, in a very Venetian neighborhood but near a vaporetto and traghetto. We often walked to the Dorsoduro and San Marco and to the Rialto Bridge. It was a pleasure to return to our truly Venetian community at the end of a long sightseeing day. We want to return and stay at the Residence Palazzo Odoni in the immediate future.

Reviews.Title: “We had a perfect stay in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: tinet190479
Reviews.Content: The Residence Pallazzo Odoni is an old genuine pallazzo that offers apartments for your stay, situated on a nice canal close to Canal Grande. Right outside the palazzo, on the canal, there are some beautiful old private houses/pallazzos and some very good restaurants that serve excellent italian food (unike many of the restaurants close to San Marco that serve more ordinary food at high prices!). The Santa Croce area is (as the Dorsoduro area) not as touristy and busy as San Marco, and we enjoyed the feeling of being in "real" Venice.The apartment we stayed in was very nice, quiet, well equipped and overlooking the canal. The owners are indeed present and very forthcoming, serviceminded and helpfull and know Venice by heart.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: lacelle
Reviews.Content: Our family of four decided to stay at the Palazzo Odoni after a friend recommended it to us. We really enjoyed our stay and it was a definite highlight of of our trip to Europe. Very quiet and well located to the main transport hubs (train, bus, water bus) and sightseeing. I would suggest getting the canal view as well to watch the gondollas go by. Lots of restaurants and cafe's close by as well as a large grocery store near the bus station. Our host, Michele, was very courteous and informative. The building itself is beautiful with modern ammenities. We did not want to leave!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: edith187
Reviews.Content: The service was good and the rooms nice and clear. Next to the train station and vaporeto station. A good play to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel”
Reviews.Author: sarag7229
Reviews.Content: nice, solid hotel. we luckily had a ground floor room because there are steep and long steps up to the rest of the rooms. the groudn floor suite was easy with our baby. the hotel not as central as we woudl have liked but it is convenient to the airport or train. good breakfast as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great find with loads of character”
Reviews.Author: michellew28
Reviews.Content: Perfect location . 5 minutes walking distance from bus terminal if coming in by plane and easy walking distance to cruise terminal. Gorgeous ambience and very personal. Stayed for 2 nights and breakfast was organised next door in a lovely courtyard. True Italian breakfast with great coffee. Also close to vaporetto stop. Staff friendly and helpful and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a family of 4”
Reviews.Author: swizzletx
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience at Residence Palazzo Odoni. It was very easy to find with the map and directions that the owner provided. The owner contacted us by email several times and was a pleasure to work with. It is a short 5 minute walk to the main area where you either catch the train, bus, or park your car. The location was the main reason we picked the hotel since we had an early morning flight and needed to be able to catch the first bus that runs at 5 am. The short walk made it very easy to catch the early bus. The residence was beautiful with a quiet and cool courtyard. The air conditioner was the best we had in Europe too. The beds were very comfortable and the hotel was very peaceful. The only drawback was there was only one bathroom, but it was not that inconvenient for the 4 of us. There are multiple little cafes and restuarants very close to the property. I would definietly stay here again if we ever return to Venice. The owner also gives a discount if paying with cash. We spent the majority of our time roaming around Venice, but the time we spent in the room was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, stunning, friendly...perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: clairej0
Reviews.Content: What more is there to say?? We stayed as a party of 11 in 3 rooms pre-cruise & it was the best decision we have made. An easy walk, even with 6 children & 12 pieces of luggage from the piazzale Roma. Near to the grand canal and many water taxi stops. The rooms were stunning. We have never stayed anywhere more beautiful. Well appointed with a kitchen for those who can stay longer. Staff were wonderful - helpful, kind and spoke excellent English (more than can be said for our Italian!) breakfast was â‚¬5 per person and was excellent too. My apologies for the delay in writing this........please, please, please can we come back??!

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful location but close to the action”
Reviews.Author: Boodlesmate
Reviews.Content: My Wife, Daughter & Sister had a 3 night stay at Residence Palazzo Odoni. It was a magnificent old building with spotless & wonderful facilities. There was no trouble sleeping at night & during the day it was not far away from all that was going on. When we arrived we encountered some substantial steps, but, no problems, Michele, our host handled all of our luggage. He was very helpful in all matters & arranged for a number of outings for us. There are restaurants everywhere in Venice but we found several very close to Palazzo & they were very reasonable in their pricing. Thank you again Michele & staff for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: Kymm76
Reviews.Content: I had high expectations for my first visit to Venice and I was not disappointed from the moment I stepped through the double doors of Palazzo Odoni. We were greeted by the ever smiling Michele as he briskly ran our very heavy suitcases up the many stairs. As we stepped into the building there was no mistaking we were in Venice! The decor was beautiful, and then Michele told us he had upgraded us to a 'canal view' apartment. Wow, amazing! The apartment was also Venetian in decor, but with modern facilities to make our stay comfortable. The view of the canal was beautiful and peaceful, a far cry from the Grand Canal, which was only a 5 minute walk away. The area is not close to San Marco(which I preferred) but the walk there takes you through the little streets, small piazzas, many canals and quaint little shops. After walking all day it was lovely to return to the Palazzo and relax under a Murano chandelier! The restaurant a few doors down, which was recommended by Michele, was also fabulous. It was called Ristorante Ribot, and the food, wine and service were fabulous. Overall, I would come back to Residence Palazzo Odoni in a heartbeat and would definitely recommend it to my friends! Thanks Michele and all of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious accomodations on canal”
Reviews.Author: skiqueenbee
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Venice and was very happy with the experience. The apartment was spacious and clean and the air conditioning was wonderful. There is even free wifi. Listening to the gondoliers singing on the canal was priceless. Michele was very accomodating to our needs. He printed out our flight boarding passes and arranged a water taxi for our trip to the airport. Thank you Palazzo Odoni!

Reviews.Title: “Fanatastic”
Reviews.Author: dudleydEdmonton
Reviews.Content: Travelling as three when finding a Hotel can be more difficult . ( a decent bed for our daughter etc.) The suite that Michele had us stay in eliminated any of our concerns.He was also very helpful with advice and guidance during our stay. First the suite was beautiful. Central location, small reastaurant next door for breakfast to get us going (5 euro per head ) and a great 2nd floor view fo the canal.40 euro cab ride to the airport or a ten min walk withe luggage to the train station. We would highly recommend this place to anyone. Doug,Deb and Chels

Reviews.Title: “Faultless”
Reviews.Author: AlexandSonja
Reviews.Content: We had a great time in the romantic city of Venice, and Palazzo Odoni contributed to that. Firstly, the rooms were enormous and the kitchenette was well-stocked. The bathroom was spotless and the jacuzzi bath was a nice treat. The bedroom was comfortable. The members of staff were very friendly. You have to leave your keys with reception on leaving the palazzo and buzz yourself in on your return - this was no problem; we were never left waiting very long outside. One of the best things about this place is the location - it is a short walk from Piazzale Roma which is handy for arriving/leaving. We visited in the winter, but I bet the courtyard is even more beautiful in the summer. I'd love to go back to Venice and would hope that the Palazzo Odoni is available!

Reviews.Title: “The real feeling of Venice”
Reviews.Author: par4
Reviews.Content: Our spacious and very clean apartment slept five comfortably. Convenient to the Piazza Roma and the Santa Lucia train station. Had a view of one of the smaller canals and could watch the gondolas go by. The owners were extremely helpful. Same accommodations near St. Mark's Square would be twice as much! A true taste of Venice. Stairs could be a hindrance to some, as there is no elevator. Would stay there again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect organization for a perfect honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Palomagil
Reviews.Content: A few weeks ago we decided among a group of friends give to a newly married couple with a staying in Venice as a wedding gift. After looking at nearly 80 hotels we chose the Palazzo Odoni, run by Michele and Ema Giangreco. This establishment offered us the double chance of hotel room and apartment, it seemed very romantic and was very well located, close to the port, bus terminal and train station Santa Lucia. But the real surprise was that, to contact them, Ema Giangreco proved to be a true professional in the organization of weddings, vow renewals and honeymoons. From the beginning, she gave us every facility to book an apartment overlooking the Gaffaro Canal to make it more beautiful, gave us a lot of very interesting suggestions that would be a surprise for the newlyweds on arrival, with a very warm treatment, engaging with genuine interest and enthusiasm in hosting the couple with flowers, toasts, breakfast in the garden and a lot of remarkable details. As a perfect ending to the stay, she hired a gondola ride ending at La Fenice Restaurant, where they had reserved a table for a romantic dinner at candlelight. And all for a really balanced price. Venecia is not a cheap city, but we came out better than doing it on our own and better than other hotels we had looked. The Giangreco know how to convey the spirit of Venice to lovers and have always been willing to help in whatever they needed during their stay. Our friends have been happy to have lived an experience they will never forget, and we have been great with such a personal attention. Do not hesitate, if you want a special place for a special occasion, choose the Palazzo Odoni. In addition to its many conveniences and comforts, will make your stay an unforgettable experience. Ema, thanks for your professionalism as organizer and your warm attention. Paloma Gil. Madrid (Spain)

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and well located near cruise terminal but a bit far from San Marco”
Reviews.Author: GoogMississauga
Reviews.Content: If you are cruising, this is a good location. Be mindful of the stairs if carrying large suitcases as it is a good climb, but all of Venice is like that. We shared an apartment ( 2 couples) to reduce costs and for 2 nights it was doable. I bedroom, pullout couch and 1 bathroom . Small kitchenette which we did not use.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and Charming Stay in an Amazing historic Building in Venice”
Reviews.Author: LizWaterloo
Reviews.Content: My sister and I, along with our partners started a 3 week European vacation in Vienna in April and May. We wanted to keep costs down and wanted to be immersed in all cultural experiences of all cities and made all arrangements on line using trip advisor as a guide. After a night in Vienna, we took a train to Venice and Residence Palazzo Odoni was exactly what we wanted and MORE. We walked from the train station and although we got lost, the locals knew the residence and gave great directions. Although it is close to the train station, it is far enough so that you get immersed in the Venetian life style from the start. With a very unpretentious gate, you ring the door bell and Michele greets you and leads you through the most amazing courtyard. The staircase leads you into a building that is what you imagine a 5th generation Venice villa. Our apartment was a large one bedroom unit with a living area that could be closed into another sleeping area with a large curtain. There was a nice kitchen with a large table and a huge modern bathroom with a jacuzzi tub/shower and bidet. The decor was again what you would expect of an antique building, and yet with all modern amenities and very clean. At night candles lined the courtyard and the staircase creating an absolutely romantic setting. Whenever we opened the gate to enter or leave the apartment, people outside would look in with the same awe we felt when we arrived. The apartment is on a canal within close walking distance to all Venice has to offer. Getting lost in the wonderful streets and canals and finding hidden gems is something that must be experienced by anyone travelling to Venice and Residence Palazzo Odoni is the perfect base. Michele & Emanuela Giangreco are exactly the type of hosts you would expect from 5th generation residence in Venice - cultured, classy, speaking excellent English with the perfect Italian style. Thank you both for the excellent start to our European adventure. We hope we can return some day.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay, will definitely come here again”
Reviews.Author: Big_Gus_Mac
Reviews.Content: We were celebrating an important anniversary, and wanted somewhere quiet, comfortable and without the hassle of 'popular' hotels. This fits the bill entirely. Michele and Emanuela could not have been more welcoming and went far out of their way to make sure we were comfortable. Their English was fluent. The Residence is a short walk away from the car park/train terminal, but far enough that it was lovely and quiet. The views from the windows were sublime. The rooms - we had an apartment - were very large and comfortable. The only down point - and this is a personal thing - was that the bed was a tad hard for my aging back. The maid came in every day to clean and tidy up. There was a whirlpool bath and a good shower. Everything was sparkling clean. We had the option of shutters and windows open, to listen to the day and nightlife of a backstreet canal in Venice. However, when both were closed, the room was almost completely silent. I saw a criticism of the access from the street in a previous review. Yes, there are a number of steps to get to reception, and yes they are quite steep. However, if you are staying at a hotel, away from the main 'bustle' of the touristy centre, you will have to walk over many bridges. We are in our late fifties, and managed perfectly well, and feel much fitter because of the experience. St Marks Square is about 25 minutes walk through some wonderful streets, The main Pallatzo Roma Vaporetto stop is 5 minutes walk away giving access to anywhere else you want to go. If this is sounds like an advertisement, it's not. We have no connection with the hotel. We just had an absolutely super week, with excellent but unobtrusive service.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Tu1lip
Reviews.Content: Lovely, spacious apartment, very comfortable and in a great location. Our rooms overlooked the canal which provided good entertainment. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “wow, what a fantastic surprise!”
Reviews.Author: duponter
Reviews.Content: first time we got in, i had trepidation when i was walking up the steps, but when we got to the apartment, it turned into a huge delightful surprise. we had a very spacious apartment with tall ceilings, chandeliers, nice curtains, and furniture to let you experience life in venice. it reminded me of one of those furnished rooms on display at the metropolitan museum, only this time, you get to sleep in one! plus my young son enjoyed watching people walk up and down the canal, he was even able to identify the different sounds; luggage, high heels,...great place!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Suites - Very Affordable”
Reviews.Author: westbank05
Reviews.Content: This was an amazing place - the suites are wonderfully decorated - with good taste. apts are in walking distance of train station and close to nearby attractions and the grand canal. the normal rooms are just as good as the canal view so try to get one of these if you can - much cheaper. wonderful host. great place to set up quickly and explore. having a kitchen is great for cooking in one night if you stay a few days.

Reviews.Title: “We all like it.”
Reviews.Author: xpeoplex
Reviews.Content: The department is near train station. There is a kitchen that you may cook by yourself. The place is clean. The ower of place is nice and can speak English. Although the room is not modern, you can have experience to stay with 500 year house.

Reviews.Title: “what a beautiful place”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneWlad
Reviews.Content: fantastic stay. Quiet, comfortable and verry venitian in style.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Ngaree
Reviews.Content: We found the owners of these Apartments to be very obliging and helpful. Our apartment overlooked a canal from both the bedroom and the living room and the rooms were beautiful and large. Apartment had good size fridge and small kitchen. Close to some great restaurants and grocery store. The railway station is only a short walk away.

Reviews.Title: “A very unpleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Reviewer033
Reviews.Content: We had a very unpleasant stay in Residence Palazzo. At the time of the booking, the owner did not specify that the hotel is divided in two different businesses - a B&B/hotel and the Residence which is apartments. Hence, when we had an issue with the missing baby crib and poorly managed utensil, we reported the issue with the staff at the reception. The staff rudely said that he could not help us with any one of the amenities of the apartment because he looks after the hotel requirements. Later on when we communicated the issue with the owner through e-mail because we did not have any phone in the apartment, and our phones were out of charge, the owner seemed very angry with the idea of sending him an e-mail. He said he would have liked if we have reported the issue when he was around. But we noticed that issue around 7:00 pm in the evening, and he was not around at that time. Later on the next day we went again in the morning to talk to him directly. We could not find him. As soon as we stepped out of the hotel, my son fell down on the streets, and he was bleeding on his mouth. We immediately went back to the apartment to look out for the owner or somebody who can help us with his bleeding. The owner was nowhere to be found. Later on one of the cleaning ladies helped us clean my sonâ€™s bleeding. Later on when we talked to the owner about our issues, he was not at all ready to listen to us, and kept on showing his disappointment with the e-mail. When we told him about our sonâ€™s mishap, he was rude and said we could have gone to pharmacist, which is two blocks from the apartment. He was not all kind, and did not show any empathy. Thanks to that cleaning lady who helped us. However there was no first aid box in the hotel. Also, some of the hotel staff was also kind. One of them helped us carry our luggage down to the apartment door early in the morning. There is no printer the hotel, and nobody provided us any information about the nearby attractions. We had been in so many hotels since the time when we arrived in Europe, and we have been welcomed with the information booklet, and necessary information about the surroundings that we expected the same with Residence Palazzo. But, when we asked, we were told to consult the information center, which is supposed to be close to the hotel. The controls for Jacuzzi in the room were not functioning properly. Once in ten times it used to work. We had been very disappointed with the ownerâ€™s behavior and his negative receptiveness to our concerns, so we did not take pains to report this issue. However, the owner did seem slightly concerned when he in the response of my e-mail, asked me to keep the windows open (in the chilling weather) while cooking to avoid causing any inconvenience to others. But it seemed more of retaliation to my e-mail than a concern for the neighbors. We do appreciate the owner for carrying our luggage up to the apartment when we arrived. We had cancelled our booking in one of the prestigious hotels located in Grand Canal at the same rate that was offered to us by the owner because of the low season. However, the owner kept on mentioning about the low rate he offered us in the e-mail. We are not fools enough to know that almost all the hotels were offering the discounted rate in low season. After talking to the owner, we regretted the idea of cancelling our previous booking. We had an issue with carrying our luggage to the apartment. Even though it is close from railway station, but it can be a major hassle if you are carrying heavy luggage and if you could not get any help from anyone to carry your luggage across the bridge. Overall, it was a very disappointing stay, which was made even more unpleasant by the ownerâ€™s response. I would not recommend the apartments in Residence Palazzo to any one of my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully Romantic Setting for Renewal of Wedding Vows”
Reviews.Author: noodles5679
Reviews.Content: Traveling with friends through Europe when Our friend surprised his wife with a renewal of their wedding vows for their 25rh anniversary. Most beautiful night time courtyard setting that any "bride" could ever imagine! I don't think you could find a more romantic setting in Italy! And by the way..the host and hostess of the residence..."fantastico"!

Reviews.Title: “Good accomm & clean throughout”
Reviews.Author: GeoffWR
Reviews.Content: We arrived slightly later than anticipated, but had assistance with our luggage. Although the outside facade of the apartment looks unloved a little, open the doors from the main st (canal) and it is a different world. Michele was always attentive and made a phonecall for me to confirm the time and place to meet the water taxi to take us back to the Airport ( I had forgot to do this on arrival at the airport). The apartment was spacious and although we never used the equipment, - other than the fridge, - it was well equiped. Cleaning is done daily and very efficiently.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable, spacious and friendly, a real treat!”
Reviews.Author: dominic66
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Palazzo Odoni for 3 days on our way back from Greece. We were instantly struck by the location, and delighted by our apartment which overlooked the canal. It was big, bright and colourful, the service was always friendly and helpful and we wouldn't hesitate to recommend the Palazzo Odoni to friends visiting Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay with Family in Venice”
Reviews.Author: dpe156
Reviews.Content: Fabulous meeting all our requirements with a one bedroom suite with a very comfy sofa bed for 2 ten year old children. Blue room has large kitchen table, good modern bathroom. Nice to have a canal view - not from this room but reality is we came home to sleep only. Close walk to train station on arrival but still close to sights. Staff will help you as there are a lot of steep stairs to reception. Not really suitable for elderly. Make sure you organise breakfast day before - we didn't but no drama's we went to a local patisserie. Felt it was great value.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite apartment in Venice”
Reviews.Author: sallylilies
Reviews.Content: I hesitate to write this review because I don't want this place to become too popular but they deserve a terrific review. This is a gorgeous apartment in a wonderful location... on a quiet little canal away from the tourist crowds and an easy walk from the train station. Beautiful entryway, lit with candles at night (steep steps though so travel light). Our apt. had a gorgeous view of the canal(the owner kindly up-graded us since it was our 25th wedding anniversary!), was beautifully decorated with fine antiques, venetian plaster walls and had a well equipped kitchen. Very spacious and comfortable. An amazing value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient place”
Reviews.Author: RaadTraveler
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel for it's location and service.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous for Venice”
Reviews.Author: Yellowleaf
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 night pre-cruise and 2 nights post cruise. Due to luggage volume of 2 adults + 2 kids, the location to Piazale Roma was the initially the reason for booking this apartment. We were pleasantly surprised once we turned into the quiet side street, rang a non-descript door bell and stepped into a beautiful courtyard. We were greeted warmly by the young owner, Michele, who graciously allowed our tired family to check in early both times once the rooms were ready. He also let us stored our extra bags for no charge while we were on the cruise. The apartment was done in beautiful Venetian style and I was particularly impressed with the Venetian plaster on the walls. Great air conditioning as the outside was extremely humid and muggy. The large bathtub was the highlight of the apartment. Michele recommended a wonderful restaurant (Restaurant Ribot) 100 yards to the right of the hotel. In the other direction approx. 500 yards was a delicious bakery. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The essence of romantic Venice”
Reviews.Author: DeniseRMiller
Reviews.Content: On my first visit to Venice and getting married, I wanted to stay at a hotel that was the essence of Venice. The Residence Palazzo Odoni was perfect.. We along with family and friends stayed at the Residence Palazzo Odoni for four incredible days. From the moment you walk throught the hugh wooded doors into the stone courtyard you feel a sense of romance and history. The owners Michele and Ema and staff greet you as if you were an old friend who has come to visit. The palace is just as shown on the website with murano chandeliers, elegant decor and modern amenities. But it's so much more. The apartments decorated in beautiful antiques,and art work make for a warm and inviting retreat. The fresh flowers enhance the welcome as if you were staying at a dear friends home. The views of the canal below just take your breath away. The staff are kind and thoughtful, passionate about making your visit to Venice and Palazzo Odoni wonderful. Ema the owners wife made all the arrangement for my wedding in the courtyard and reception and at Ribo's Restaurant steps from the Palazzo Odoni. The only thing I had to do was select the menu and flowers. She created a wedding venue that was both beautiful and mystical. The reception was elegant and romantic. Being serenaded in the garden by venetian musician, I was in complete awe. The owners Ema and Michele and staff at Residence Palazzo Odoni cater to you as if you were royality. And experience I will never forget. This is an amazing place. I cherish my new found friends in Venice and intend to return often. This is the best place in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “A most wonderful experience from start to finish!”
Reviews.Author: Philip1964
Reviews.Content: A fantastic base for a stay in Venice. 5 minutes from the direct bus from Marco Polo Airport and right at the hub of all travel & sight-seeing needs. The suite was massive, and the canal view was enchanting through three large windows.
